Scientific Expedition to Lake Superior photograph collection

did.abstract: Stereoscopic photos from a scientific expedition to Michigan's upper peninsula and Lake Superior in 1868 organized by Albert E. Foote, assistant in the University of Michigan Chemistry Laboratory; includes views of the expedition's boats and camps, natural features including the Pictured Rocks and waterfalls, mining operations, Indians, ships, and a lighthouse.

bioghist.p: Expedition to Isle Royale and the north shore of Lake Superior in 1868, organized by Albert E. Foote, assistant in the University of Michigan Chemistry Laboratory.
For more information about this expedition see:
Mark Walrod Harrington, "Our Lake Superior Trip," The Michigan University Magazine , No. 3 (1868/69): 170-174, 213-217, 276-270, 317-321 (Bentley Library call number Fimu/F3f)
"Statement of Operations of the Museum ... for the year ending September 24th, 1868"Proceedings of the Board of Regents of the University of Michigan , 1864-70: 291-301 (Bentley call number Fimu/B2)

scopecontent.p: Stereograph views of the expedition's boats and camps, natural features including the Pictured Rocks and waterfalls, mining operations, Indians, ships, and a lighthouse. The original set of cards apparently included 127 numbered items. There are twenty-four items missing form the Bentley's collection. the collection also includes several photographic prints, some of which appear to be reprints from the cards, and some note about the expedition and the collection made by F. Clever Bald, director of the Michigan Historical Collections, about 1950
